difficultyList.Name: Ironman Mode
difficultyList.Tooltip: Ironman Mode restricts you to only one save file. All consequences, including 'Mech loss, MechWarrior death, and failed missions are permanent. Running out of funds or failing any Priority Mission will result in Career loss. This setting is intended for veterans and those seeking a significant challenge.

difficultyList.Name: Randomize starting 'Mechs
difficultyList.Tooltip: When active, this setting randomizes your starting set of five 'Mechs

difficultyList.Name: Unequipped 'Mechs
difficultyList.Tooltip: When this setting is enabled, new 'Mechs you acquire through salvage will not come with equipped weapons or components, and will need to be customized from scratch.

difficultyList.Name:
Parts for 'Mech Assembly
4 - (N/H), 5 - (S)
difficultyList.Tooltip: This setting controls the number of salvaged or purchased 'Mech parts you must acquire to assemble a new 'Mech. Increase this value to make new 'Mechs rarer and more difficult to obtain. <color=#F79B26>This setting is intended for veterans and those seeking a significant challenge.</color>

difficultyList.Name: Enemy Force Strength
difficultyList.Tooltip: This setting modifies the overall strength of enemy forces. At higher difficulties, you will encounter heavier 'Mechs.

difficultyList.Name: Advanced MechWarriors
difficultyList.Tooltip: In the later parts of the game, new MechWarriors in the Hiring Hall will often have better stats and skills than in the early parts of the game. Modify this setting to change the frequency of new MechWarriors having these improvements.

difficultyList.Name: 'Mech Destruction
difficultyList.Tooltip: When active, this setting will cause any 'Mech disabled by the destruction of its center torso to be lost permanently. <color=#F79B26>This setting is intended for veterans and those seeking a significant challenge.</color>

difficultyList.Name: Contract Payment
difficultyList.Tooltip: This setting controls the amount of C-Bills paid by contracts across the entire game. Adjust this setting to make the economic gameplay more or less forgiving.

difficultyList.Name: Salvage
difficultyList.Tooltip: This setting changes the amount of salvage you may obtain from negotiation. Adjust this setting to make the economic gameplay more or less forgiving.

difficultyList.Name: MechWarrior Progression
difficultyList.Tooltip: This setting controls the amount of experience MechWarriors gain after each mission. Change this setting to adjust the rate at which MechWarriors improve their stats and gain new skills.

difficultyList.Name: Lethality
difficultyList.Tooltip: When this setting is enabled, MechWarriors that are incapacitated in combat will always be killed.

difficultyList.Name: No Rare Salvage
difficultyList.Tooltip: This setting controls whether "+" and "++" items can be found as salvage after a battle. If this setting is enabled, only basic items will be found.

difficultyList.Name: Reduced Argo Upgrade Costs
difficultyList.Tooltip: This setting controls the costs of Argo Upgrades. If this setting is Enabled, Argo Ship Upgrades will cost less for both the upfront Purchase Costs as well as the Additional Costs paid each month for completed upgrades.

difficultyList.Name: Starting Planet
difficultyList.Tooltip: This Setting decides at which planet you start defined by Faction

difficultyList.Name: Overall Difficulty
difficultyList.Tooltip:
This setting controls the underlying difficulty of the game and reduces the X-Com effect, too hard early game, too easy late game.

Normal is effectively 'Easy'. Similar to the Vanilla game with much less changes to balance the experience and leaves many 'exploits' in tact.

Hard increases the difficulty in combat late game, including the AI using appropriate pilot skills, and lessening late game Resolve bonuses.

Simulation adds in additonal elements to give a more hardcore immersive Company Commander experience. Improving the Strategy level experience to balance 'Mech and Pilot use appropriately to missions and includes a new Heat system to balance weapon usage.

Simulation + adds Tabletop inspired extra Tactical level changes to improve 'Mech degredation as they are damaged and a reworked Bulwark skill.

Other settings in this menu are flagged with N/H/S values for suggested settings for the difficulty level.

difficultyList.Name: Starting Year
difficultyList.Tooltip:
Select your start date.

3025 End of Third Succession War
3028 Fourth Succession War
3030 Andurien/St. Ives Succession
3034 Rasalhague Independence
3039 War of 3039
3047 Helm Memory Core Technology Renaissance
3049 Clan Invasion
3053 Post Truce of Tukayyid
3057 Operation GUERRERO
3059 Operation BULLDOG
3061 Prior to FedCom Civil War
3067 End of FedCom Civil War

New technologies begin to appear in 3047 but remain rare until the mid- to late 3050s. Clans arrive in August 3049.

The timeline holds on the map until 3067, prior to the Word of Blake Jihad. New 'Mechs, vehicles, and technologies will continue to be added up until that point.
